alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 29 at 4:19PM EDT until April 01 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM WEDNESDAY TO 10 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Minor to moderate coastal flooding possible. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 3 to 6 feet expected in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Coastal Franklin County. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 2 PM Wednesday to 10 AM EDT Friday. The Coastal Flood Watch is in effect from Wednesday night through Thursday. Water levels will be highest around times of high tide, which is between 2 AM and 4 AM on Thursday morning and again between 2 PM and 4 PM on Thursday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from 11 PM EDT this evening through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Water levels are expected to be highest east of Carrabelle. With peak water levels of 2 to 4 feet above ground possible, overwash onto Alligator Point Road is possible, as is minor to moderate flooding of areas near St Teresa Beach. Due to accompanying high surf, some shoreline erosion may occur. Dangerous rip currents are expected and can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
